question: <katex>$\int\sqrt{\text{cosec }x-\sin x}dx=$</katex>
explanation: <katex>$\sqrt{\frac{1}{\sin x} - \sin x} = \sqrt{\frac{1-\sin^2 x}{\sin x}} = \sqrt{\frac{\cos^2 x}{\sin x}} = \frac{\cos x}{\sqrt{\sin x}}$</katex>.
Let <katex>$\sin x = t$</katex>, <katex>$\cos x dx = dt$</katex>.
Integral becomes <katex>$\int t^{-1/2} dt = \frac{t^{1/2}}{1/2} + C = 2\sqrt{t} + C = 2\sqrt{\sin x} + C$</katex>.
